Query: How do I change extension of multiple files recursively from the command line?

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_43503733: Change basename of multiple files in a single directory
au_821435: How can I change file types of multiple files at once?
ul_438476: Change extension of all file names containing specific string
Top-3 Scripts:
so_43503733: # Looping for all the text files in the current 
# directory
for file in *.txt; do
    # Stripping off '_R1' from the file-name
    temp1="${file//_R1/}"
    # Replacing '_' with '.' and renaming the file to the name generated
    temp2="${temp1//_/.}"
    echo "$temp2" "$file"
    #mv -v "$file" "$temp2"
done

au_821435: for f in A*; do 
  printf -v fnew '%s.%02d' "${f%.*}" "${f##*.}"
  echo mv -v -- "$f" "$fnew"
done

ul_438476: find -type f -name "*x264*" -execdir sh -c 'file="${1#./}"; 
    echo mv -n "$file" "${file%.*}.mp4"' _ {}  \;
